Package src.lazykits.statistics

Class DesData

java.lang.Object
src.lazykits.statistics.DesData
All Implemented Interfaces:
Statistic
public class DesData extends Object implements Statistic
Class for calculating descriptive statistics. This class provides methods to compute mean, variance, standard deviation, median, and mode of a dataset. It also allows calculating the confidence interval for the mean based on the z-score or t-score depending on the sample size.

    • sampVari

      public double sampVari()
      Calculates the variance of an array of doubles using the sample formula (divided by n-1). This method provides an unbiased estimator of the population variance when the data is a sample.
      Specified by:
      sampVari in interface Statistic
      Returns:
      The sample variance.

    • MLbound

      public double MLbound(double confidenceLevel)
      "μ estimate": (σ unknown) Calculates the lower bound of the confidence interval for the mean when the population standard deviation is unknown. This method uses the t-distribution for small sample sizes (n ≤ 30) and the z-distribution for larger sample sizes. The choice of distribution depends on the assumption that the sample mean approximates the population mean.
      Parameters:
      confidenceLevel - The desired confidence level as a percentage (e.g., 95 for 95%). Must be between 0 and 100, exclusive. Determines how confident one is that the true parameter lies within the calculated interval.
      Returns:
      The lower bound of the confidence interval for the mean.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if confidenceLevel is not within the valid range or if the data array is empty. Valid range for confidenceLevel is between 0 and 100, exclusive.

    • MLbound

      public double MLbound(double confidenceLevel, double sigma)
      "μ estimate": (σ known) Calculates the lower bound of the confidence interval for the mean when the population standard deviation is known. This method uses the z-distribution regardless of sample size.
      Parameters:
      confidenceLevel - The desired confidence level in percentage.
      sigma - The known population standard deviation, must be non-negative.
      Returns:
      The lower bound of the confidence interval.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if sigma is negative or confidenceLevel is out of range.

    • MLbound

      public double MLbound(double confidenceLevel, double sigma, double mean, double sample)
      "μ estimate": Calculates the lower bound of the confidence interval for the mean when the population standard deviation (sigma) is known. This method uses the z-distribution for large sample sizes (greater than 30) and the t-distribution for smaller sample sizes.
      Parameters:
      confidenceLevel - The desired confidence level as a percentage (e.g., 95 for 95% confidence).
      sigma - The current standard deviation. This parameter must be non-negative.
      mean - The sample mean.
      sample - The sample size. It determines whether the z-distribution or t-distribution is used.
      Returns:
      The lower bound of the confidence interval for the mean.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if sigma is negative, or if the confidence level is not within a sensible range (e.g., 0 to 100).

    • MUbound

      public double MUbound(double confidenceLevel)
      "μ estimate": (σ unknown) Calculates the upper bound of the confidence interval for the mean when the population standard deviation is unknown. Applies the same distributional assumptions as for the lower bound.
      Parameters:
      confidenceLevel - The desired confidence level in percentage.
      Returns:
      The upper bound of the confidence interval.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the data array is empty or confidenceLevel is invalid.

    • MUbound

      public double MUbound(double confidenceLevel, double sigma)
      "μ estimate": (σ known) Calculates the upper bound of the confidence interval for the mean when the population standard deviation is known. This method provides a more precise estimate when sigma is known, using the z-distribution.
      Parameters:
      confidenceLevel - The desired confidence level in percentage.
      sigma - The known population standard deviation, must be non-negative.
      Returns:
      The upper bound of the confidence interval.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if sigma is negative or confidenceLevel is invalid.

    • MUbound

      public double MUbound(double confidenceLevel, double sigma, double mean, double sample)
      "μ estimate": Calculates the upper bound of the confidence interval for the mean when the population standard deviation (sigma) is known. This method uses the z-distribution for large sample sizes (greater than 30) and the t-distribution for smaller sample sizes.
      Parameters:
      confidenceLevel - The desired confidence level as a percentage (e.g., 95 for 95% confidence).
      sigma - The current standard deviation. This parameter must be non-negative.
      mean - The sample mean.
      sample - The sample size. It determines whether the z-distribution or t-distribution is used.
      Returns:
      The upper bound of the confidence interval for the mean.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if sigma is negative, or if the confidence level is not within a sensible range (e.g., 0 to 100).

    • pCI

      public double[] pCI(double confidenceLevel, int successes, int trials)
      Calculates the confidence interval for a Bernoulli parameter p using the z-score.
      Parameters:
      successes - Number of successes in the Bernoulli trials.
      trials - Total number of Bernoulli trials.
      confidenceLevel - The desired confidence level in percentage (e.g., 95 for 95%).
      Returns:
      A double array containing the lower and upper bounds of the confidence interval.

    • varCI

      public double[] varCI(double confidenceLevel)
      Calculates the confidence interval for the variance of the population from which the sample was drawn. Assumes the sample variance is an unbiased estimator of the population variance.
      Parameters:
      confidenceLevel - The desired confidence level as a percentage (e.g., 95 for 95% CI).
      Returns:
      A double array containing the lower and upper bounds of the confidence interval for the variance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if sampleSize is less than 2, which is insufficient for variance estimation.

    • varCI

      public double[] varCI(double confidenceLevel, double variance, int sampleSize)
      Calculates the confidence interval for the variance of the population from which the sample was drawn. Assumes the sample variance is an unbiased estimator of the population variance.
      Parameters:
      confidenceLevel - The desired confidence level as a percentage (e.g., 95 for 95% CI).
      variance - The sample variance.
      sampleSize - The size of the sample.
      Returns:
      A double array containing the lower and upper bounds of the confidence interval for the variance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if sampleSize is less than 2, which is insufficient for variance estimation.
